Experimental evaluation of how biological invasions and climate change interact to alter the vertical assembly of an amphibian community
This paper uses a novel experimental system to show how an antagonistic invasive species and climate-induced drought may act jointly to affect the vertical assembly of a common treefrog community in the Southeastern USA.
J Alex Baecher, Steve A. Johnson, Elizabeth A. Roznik, Brett R. Scheffers
PDF Cite Code Dataset DOI Slides Project Supplimental Info Press: Florida Today Press: Nature CC Press: USGS Press: Newser Press: The Science Times
Vertical stratification patterns of tropical forest vertebrates
This paper describes a thorough meta-analysis on the factors that determine vertical stratification of vertebrate taxa across the global tropics.
Edmund W. Basham, J Alex Baecher, Steve A. Johnson, David H. Klinges, Brett R. Scheffers
PDF Cite Code Dataset DOI Project Edmund Basham Supplimental Info
Large, old trees define the vertical, horizontal, and seasonal distributions of a poison frog
This paper shows the importance of large, dominant, old-growth trees to sensitive arboreal poison frogs in tropical ecosystems, by providing core habitat that species use intermittently across seasons.
Edmund W. Basham, J Alex Baecher, Brett R. Scheffers
PDF Cite Code Dataset DOI Project Edmund Basham Correction
Prey Size and Feeding Rate Do Not Influence Trophic Morphology of Juvenile Water Snakes (Nerodia sipedon)
This paper used feeding experiments to test the hypothesis that trophic morphology of common watersnakes is influenced by the size of prey it consumes, by way of phenotypic plasticity.
Meredith C. Swarthwout, Philip Vogrinc, J Alex Baecher, Chelsea Kross, John D. Willson

A description of morphological abnormalities (tail bifurcation) in Plethodontid salamanders.
J Alex Baecher, Emily Jones, Stephen C. Richter

Cryopreservation and hormonal induction of spermic urine in smooth-sided toads
This paper tests multiple laboratory protocols for cryoperserving the sperm of sensitive amphibians for assisted reproductive technologies to aid in conserving tropical amphibian taxa.
Kristin M. Hinkson, J Alex Baecher, Sinlan Poo

Environmental gradients in old‐growth Appalachian forest predict fine‐scale distribution, co‐occurrence, and density of woodland salamanders
This paper examines how natural environmental gradients in old growth Appalachian forest determine the abundance and occurrence of sensitive woodland salamanders.
J Alex Baecher, Stephen C. Richter

Herpetofaunal Communities in Restored and Unrestored Remnant Tallgrass Prairie and Associated Wetlands in Northwest Arkansas, USA
This paper looks at how wetland restoration in grassland ecosystems may benefit prairie-adapted reptiles and amphibians.

Lithobates areolatus (crawfish frog) predation
